review: They knocked this one out of the park.  It was a snap to install.  It hooked into my wireless network easily -- something some other streaming devices still struggle with -- and the integration with the other devices in my house (from laptops to Android phones) was immediate and seamless.  I mean that, really.  We got it in, and suddenly both my phone and my wife's were able to send YouTube videos to the TV, and it even managed the conflict between the two of us by establishing a "Stream to TV" Queue.It used to be that the "Watch it Later" button on YouTube was a way for me to express interest in a video but tacitly acknowledge that I was never going to take the time to watch it.  There are better things to do at my desktop.  But chilling out in the bedroom.  Sure, I'll queue up half a dozen little videos and catch up every few days.So yeah, this one worked so well that it was practically indistinguishable from magic.

review: Works great. Setup is a little cumbersome but once installed, it works perfect. Have seen a few online automatic updates since buying it on opening day. I like it so much I bought a second one to give as a gift.I bought with the expectation that it will become more versatile as more vendors take advantage of it and Google expands its capability.Before buying this my Netflix app was only on my Samsung Blu-Ray player which meant I could only watch Netflix material on the computer to which it is connected. Now I can move the Chromecast dongle to any HDMI capable TV and watch Netflix there.Thumbs up! Assuming Google enhances its firmware and versatility in the future.

review: I love the Chromecast, but ...  The problem is with Chrome (the browser) for Android.  My android phone AND my android tablet CANNOT cast a tab to the Chromecast device at all, as it is NOT supported.  You can only cast a tab using a Chrome browser installed on a PC or Mac, and never on an android phone or tablet as the modified android Chrome browser does not support casting.That sucks.I suggest EVERYONE email and write Google to add Chromecast support to the android Chrome browser.  THEN this little gadget would be PERFECT and everyone should have one.  Until then, it only gets 4 out of 5 stars.

review: Chromecast is a neat idea but at this time that is all it is.  Without support for more apps it has extremely limited use.  You might as well pay the extra money and buy a Roku or Apple TV which have a full feature set.  The only reason i'm giving two stars is that the device itself is neat and works decently from a technical perspective.
